The Russian leader brushed off the effectiveness of the apparent protest and rejected Western criticism of the vote. Instead, he tried to turn the tables on the West, charging that the four criminal cases against former President Donald Trump were a use of the judiciary for political aims.
“The whole world is laughing at it,” he said.
Some people told the AP that they were happy to vote for Putin — unsurprising in a country where state TV airs a drumbeat of praise for the Russian leader and voicing any other opinion is risky.
Dmitry Sergienko, who cast his ballot in Moscow, said, “I am happy with everything and want everything to continue as it is now.”
Voting took place over three days at polling stations across the vast country, in illegally annexed regions of Ukraine and online.
Several people were arrested, including in Moscow and St. Petersburg, after they tried to start fires or set off explosives at polling stations while a few others were detained for throwing green antiseptic or ink into ballot boxes. Many more were rounded up by police for attempting to protest.
The OVD-Info group that monitors political arrests said that about 90 people were arrested in 22 cities across Russia on Sunday.
Stanislav Andreychuk, co-chair of the Golos independent election watchdog, said Russians were searched when entering polling stations, there were attempts to check filled-out ballots before they were cast, and one report said police demanded a ballot box be opened to remove a ballot.
Huge lines formed around noon outside diplomatic missions in London, Berlin, Paris and other cities with large Russian communities, many of whom left home after Putin's invasion of Ukraine.

title: 新华社快讯：初步统计数据显示普京在俄总统选举中得票领先 - 新华网客户端
content: 莫斯科时间17日21时许，俄罗斯中央选举委员会发布初步统计数据显示，普京在俄总统选举中得票领先。
translation: At about 21:00 on the 17th, Moscow time, Russia’s Central Election Commission released preliminary statistics showing that Putin was leading the vote in the Russian presidential election.
input: At about 21:00 on the 17th, Moscow time, Russia’s Central Election Commission released preliminary statistics showing that Putin was leading the vote in the Russian presidential election.

title: 习近平祝贺普京“连任”   中俄联手引发国际安全担忧 — 普通话主页
content:
普京在总统选举后的新闻发布会上也继续向中方“投诚”。他表示，中国的敌人在台湾周边的挑衅注定会失败。
林剑对此回应说：“中方高度赞赏普京总统的表态。世界上只有一个中国，中华人民共和国政府是代表全中国的唯一合法政府，台湾是中国领土不可分割的一部分。这是国际社会普遍共识和国际关系基本准则。”
学者：中俄继续强化联盟 对抗西方
美国萨姆休斯顿州立大学政治学系副教授翁履中分析指出，在普京接下来的6年任期中，俄罗斯无疑会进一步加强与中国的联盟关系。
“不仅仅会加强跟中国，还会加强跟印度的关系。”他说：“我相信，普京越来越觉得就算俄乌战争打出结果，俄罗斯稍微占上风，以美国为首的西方国家大概也不会改变对俄罗斯的态度。所以就让普京更加觉得要与西方国家保持距离，关键在于能不能拉拢中国和印度。”
但翁履中认为，俄罗斯深陷俄乌战争泥潭，并没有能力协助中国在台海的激进行动。且中俄联盟仍以各自利益为基础，而并非“知己”。
他说：“普京虽然对台海局势表态，甚至强调台湾是中国的一部分，最主要是在外交上表达对中国的支持，然后拉拢跟中国的关系。中国现在希望透过俄罗斯传达给美国的讯号是：如果美方对中国的态度不改变，中国就会选择跟俄罗斯走得近一些。”
本台曾报道，普京上月在接受美国前福克斯新闻主持人塔克·卡尔森（Tucker Carlson）的专访时，曾暗示西方将矛头对准中国。普京直言，就人口和经济规模而言，俄罗斯远落后于中国：“西方对一个强大的中国的恐惧，远超对强大的俄罗斯的恐惧。”
王维正分析说，虽然中俄两国表示伙伴关系“上不封顶”，但实际上是“各怀鬼胎”，目前两国的共同利益仍是如何对抗西方。
他说：“俄罗斯的话，虽然是苏联的继承者，但它对中国的崛起其实也非常忐忑不安。毕竟过去是苏联跟美国平起平坐，现在中国崛起之后，是不是中国跟美国平起平坐？在这样局势下，俄罗斯是不是变成中国的附庸国？”
王维正进一步指出，美国政府发布的国家安全战略已经确定中国是“唯一一个既有意图，也越来越有能力重塑国际秩序的竞争对手”。就当前的国际局势来看，俄罗斯可能有意图，但并不具有能力，因此俄罗斯必须与中国合作，共同对抗西方和现行国际秩序。
据中国海关总署统计，2022年，中俄双边贸易额达到了创纪录的1902.7亿美元，同比增长29.3%。在俄乌战争爆发、俄罗斯面临西方社会制裁的情况下，中国成为俄罗斯最重要的贸易伙伴。
translation:
Putin also continued to "surrender" to China at the press conference after the presidential election. He said that provocations by China's enemies around Taiwan are destined to fail.
Lin Jian responded: "China highly appreciates President Putin's statement. There is only one China in the world, the government of the People's Republic of China is the only legal government representing all of China, and Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory. This is a general consensus of the international community. and basic norms of international relations.”
Scholar: China and Russia continue to strengthen alliance to fight against the West
Weng Lvzhong, associate professor at the Department of Political Science at Sam Houston State University in the United States, analyzed that in Putin’s next six-year term, Russia will undoubtedly further strengthen its alliance with China.
"Not only will it strengthen relations with China, but also with India." He said: "I believe that Putin increasingly feels that even if the Russia-Ukraine war ends and Russia has a slight upper hand, Western countries led by the United States will probably not It will change his attitude towards Russia. Therefore, Putin feels that the key to keeping a distance from Western countries is whether he can win over China and India.”
However, Weng Luzhong believes that Russia is trapped in the quagmire of the Russia-Ukraine war and is not capable of assisting China's aggressive actions in the Taiwan Strait. Moreover, the Sino-Russian alliance is still based on their respective interests and is not "confidest friends".
He said: "Although Putin expressed his stance on the situation in the Taiwan Strait and even emphasized that Taiwan is part of China, the most important thing is to express diplomatic support for China and then to improve relations with China. The signal that China now hopes to convey to the United States through Russia is : If the US attitude towards China does not change, China will choose to get closer to Russia.”
This station has reported that Putin hinted that the West would target China in an exclusive interview with former American Fox News host Tucker Carlson last month. Putin bluntly stated that Russia lags far behind China in terms of population and economic size: "The West's fear of a powerful China far exceeds its fear of a powerful Russia."
Wang Weizheng analyzed that although China and Russia stated that their partnership was “unlimited,” in reality, they had “each other’s own agenda.” At present, the common interest of the two countries is still how to confront the West.
He said: "As for Russia, although it is the successor of the Soviet Union, it is actually very uneasy about the rise of China. After all, the Soviet Union and the United States were equal in the past. Now after the rise of China, will China be equal to the United States? In such a situation, Has Russia become a vassal state of China?”
Wang Weizheng further pointed out that the national security strategy issued by the U.S. government has determined that China is “the only competitor that has both the intention and the ability to reshape the international order.” Judging from the current international situation, Russia may have intentions but does not have the capabilities. Therefore, Russia must cooperate with China to jointly confront the West and the current international order.
According to statistics from the General Administration of Customs of China, the bilateral trade volume between China and Russia reached a record high of US$190.27 billion in 2022, a year-on-year increase of 29.3%. When the Russo-Ukrainian war broke out and Russia faced sanctions from Western societies, China became Russia's most important trading partner.

title: 普京胜选！最新讲话回应这些问题
content:
据新华社报道，俄罗斯中央选举委员会当地时间18日凌晨发布的数据显示，在俄总统选举统计完成的85%选票中，现任总统普京以87.19%的得票率大幅领先其他候选人，实际已经赢得此次总统选举。
俄罗斯第八届总统选举正式投票于15日至17日举行。根据俄总统选举规则，在选举中获得50%以上选票者当选总统。俄中央选举委员会将不晚于3月28日确认此次总统选举结果，并在选举结果确认后3日内予以公布。
公开信息显示，现年71岁的普京作为俄现任总统的任期将于2024年5月7日结束。根据俄罗斯宪法，普京可以在此次任期结束后寻求连任两届至2036年。

胜选
据新华社报道，普京18日凌晨在竞选总部发表讲话，感谢所有选民的支持。他表示俄罗斯是一个大家庭，本次选举结果体现了选民的信任和期望，国家的所有任务都将完成。俄罗斯将会进一步向前发展，变得更坚实、更强大、更高效。
在讲话中，普京也提及了未来的挑战。他首先感谢身处冲突前线的战士，表示目前俄罗斯的首要任务肯定是完成特别军事行动。他称，俄军已掌握战争主导权，如果西方军队出现在乌克兰，就可能会将世界推向第三次世界大战的边缘。普京还强调，只要国家团结，没有人可以压制俄罗斯。
另外，普京也谈到俄罗斯与中国的关系，表示中俄关系是稳定因素，中国在全球舞台上非常成功，他确信未来几年两国关系将会更加牢固。
相较于此前的选举，此次大选拥有多个“首次”的纪录，比如首次采用多日持续投票，首次采用实地投票和远程电子投票相结合的方式进行。同时在此次选举期间，民意调查也多天开放。
translation:
According to Xinhua News Agency, data released by the Russian Central Election Commission in the early morning of the 18th local time showed that among the 85% of votes counted in the Russian presidential election, the current President Putin led other candidates by a large margin with 87.19% of the votes, and actually won the election. presidential election.
Official voting for Russia’s eighth presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to the Russian presidential election rules, the person who gets more than 50% of the votes in the election is elected president. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within 3 days after the election results are confirmed.
Public information shows that the 71-year-old Putin’s term as the current president of Russia will end on May 7, 2024. According to the Russian constitution, Putin can seek re-election for two terms until 2036 after this term ends.

Win the election
According to Xinhua News Agency, Putin delivered a speech at the campaign headquarters in the early morning of the 18th, thanking all voters for their support. He said that Russia is a big family, and the results of this election reflect the trust and expectations of voters, and all the country's tasks will be completed. Russia will move forward and become more solid, stronger and more efficient.
In his speech, Putin also mentioned the challenges ahead. He first thanked the soldiers on the front lines of the conflict and said that Russia's current priority must be to complete special military operations. He said that the Russian army has taken the lead in the war, and if Western troops appear in Ukraine, it may push the world to the brink of World War III. Putin also emphasized that as long as the country is united, no one can suppress Russia.
In addition, Putin also talked about the relationship between Russia and China, saying that Sino-Russian relations are a stabilizing factor. China is very successful on the global stage. He is convinced that the relationship between the two countries will be stronger in the next few years.
Compared with previous elections, this election has a number of "firsts" records, such as the first use of multi-day continuous voting, and the first use of a combination of on-site voting and remote electronic voting. Also during this election, polls are open on multiple days.

Official voting for Russia’s eighth presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to the Russian presidential election rules, the person who gets more than 50% of the votes in the election is elected president. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within 3 days after the election results are confirmed.
Public information shows that the 71-year-old Putin’s term as the current president of Russia will end on May 7, 2024. According to the Russian constitution, Putin can seek re-election for two terms until 2036 after this term ends.

Win the election
According to Xinhua News Agency, Putin delivered a speech at the campaign headquarters in the early morning of the 18th, thanking all voters for their support. He said that Russia is a big family, and the results of this election reflect the trust and expectations of voters, and all the country's tasks will be completed. Compared with previous elections, this election has a number of "firsts" records, such as the first use of multi-day continuous voting, and the first use of a combination of on-site voting and remote electronic voting. Also during this election, polls are open on multiple days.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024｜五个“首次”，这场选举有何特殊？
content:
对于俄罗斯海外选民，俄驻外大使馆负责人可以视情况改变投票的开始、结束和持续时间。
该法还明确规定，只有获得授权的人员才能在投票现场拍摄照片和视频，拥有正式工作合同的媒体记者才能在投票站获得认证。在俄罗斯境内宣布进入战时状态的地区，还将采取额外保护措施，确保选民的安全和投票过程的顺利进行。俄国家杜马表示，此举旨在让生活在前线地区以及执行作战任务的人能够参加投票。
与此同时，这也将是俄罗斯首次在顿涅茨克、卢甘斯克、扎波罗热和赫尔松四个“新地区”举行总统大选投票，目前四地均处于战时状态。
此前，在普京2023年5月签署了允许在实行战时状态的地区举行选举的法律后，上述四地曾举行地方选举。随后，根据俄罗斯中央选举委员会2023年12月通过的一项关于总统选举的相关决议，顿涅茨克、卢甘斯克、扎波罗热和赫尔松地区将举行俄罗斯总统大选投票。考虑到当地民众可能因为各种原因尚未取得俄罗斯护照，上述地区的选举委员会将有权确定，如当地选民在投票时无法出示俄罗斯护照，还可以出示哪些证件以顺利参与总统选举投票。
此次俄罗斯大选正式投票将在3月15-17日举行，而这将是俄罗斯首次举行为期3天的总统大选投票。多日投票方式最初被应用于新冠疫情期间，以防投票站出现选民过度拥挤的情况。据媒体报道，该投票方式的首次应用是在2020年6月25日至7月1日的俄罗斯修宪全民公投期间。
此次选举还将是俄首次在总统大选中采用实地投票和远程电子投票相结合的方式进行。根据俄罗斯官方说明，俄罗斯共有29个地区可以申请远程投票。在这些地区，人们可以选择前往当地投票站进行现场投票，也可以在1月29日至3月11日期间提交远程投票申请后，通过电脑或手机参与投票。
另外，据俄罗斯外交部消息，由于与不友好国家关系紧张，部分俄罗斯驻海外使领馆被关闭，俄罗斯此次大选在海外设置的投票站数量也因此减少。俄罗斯中央选举委员会成员帕维尔∙安德烈耶夫2月21日表示，俄罗斯联邦总统选举期间将在海外144个国家设立281个投票站，并在拜科努尔市设立7个投票站，国外投票站总数将达到288个。而在2018年总统选举中，俄罗斯在海外设置了394个投票站。俄罗斯外交部发言人扎哈罗娃表示，俄罗斯使领馆的安全形势近期明显恶化，并非所有欧美国家都对俄方要求确保选举日投票站安全的照会做出了回应。安德烈耶夫针对海外投票站的减少也表示，这不是俄罗斯的错误，而是投票站所在国的错误。
translation:
For Russian overseas voters, the head of the Russian embassy abroad can change the start, end and duration of voting depending on the situation.
The law also clearly stipulates that only authorized personnel can take photos and videos at polling sites, and media reporters with formal work contracts can be certified at polling stations. In areas of Russia where a state of war has been declared, additional protective measures will be taken to ensure the safety of voters and the smooth conduct of the voting process. The Russian State Duma said the move was aimed at allowing people living in frontline areas and on combat missions to participate in the vote.
At the same time, this will also be the first time that Russia holds presidential election voting in the four "new regions" of Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporizhia and Kherson. All four regions are currently in a state of war.
Previously, after Putin signed a law in May 2023 allowing elections to be held in areas subject to wartime conditions, local elections were held in the above four places. Subsequently, according to a relevant resolution on the presidential election adopted by the Russian Central Election Commission in December 2023, voting for the Russian presidential election will be held in the Donetsk, Luhansk, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions. Considering that local people may not have obtained Russian passports for various reasons, the election committees in the above-mentioned regions will have the right to determine what documents local voters can present to successfully participate in the presidential election voting if they are unable to present their Russian passports when voting.
The official voting in the Russian election will be held from March 15 to 17, and this will be the first time that Russia holds a three-day presidential election voting. Multi-day voting was originally used during the coronavirus pandemic to prevent overcrowding of voters at polling stations. According to media reports, the first application of this voting method was during the Russian constitutional referendum from June 25 to July 1, 2020.
This election will also be the first time that Russia uses a combination of on-site voting and remote electronic voting in a presidential election. According to Russian official instructions, a total of 29 regions in Russia can apply for remote voting. In these areas, people can choose to go to local polling stations to vote in person, or they can vote via computer or mobile phone after submitting a remote voting application from January 29 to March 11.
In addition, according to the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, due to tensions with unfriendly countries, some Russian embassies and consulates overseas have been closed, and the number of Russian polling stations set up overseas for this election has also been reduced. Pavel Andreev, a member of the Russian Central Election Commission, said on February 21 that 281 polling stations will be set up in 144 overseas countries during the Russian Federation’s presidential election, and 7 polling stations will be set up in Baikonur. The total number of polling stations will reach 288. In the 2018 presidential election, Russia set up 394 polling stations overseas. Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zakharova said that the security situation at Russian embassies and consulates has deteriorated significantly recently, and not all European and American countries have responded to Russia’s note requesting to ensure the security of polling stations on election day. Regarding the reduction of overseas polling stations, Andreev also said that this is not Russia’s fault, but the fault of the country where the polling stations are located.

This election will also be the first time that Russia uses a combination of on-site voting and remote electronic voting in a presidential election. According to Russian official instructions, a total of 29 regions in Russia can apply for remote voting. In these areas, people can choose to go to local polling stations to vote in person, or they can vote via computer or mobile phone after submitting a remote voting application from January 29 to March 11.
In addition, according to the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, due to tensions with unfriendly countries, some Russian embassies and consulates overseas have been closed, and the number of Russian polling stations set up overseas for this election has also been reduced. Pavel Andreev, a member of the Russian Central Election Commission, said on February 21 that 281 polling stations will be set up in 144 overseas countries during the Russian Federation’s presidential election, and 7 polling stations will be set up in Baikonur. The total number of polling stations will reach 288. In the 2018 presidential election, Russia set up 394 polling stations overseas. Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zakharova said that the security situation at Russian embassies and consulates has deteriorated significantly recently, and not all European and American countries have responded to Russia’s note requesting to ensure the security of polling stations on election day. Regarding the reduction of overseas polling stations, Andreev also said that this is not Russia’s fault, but the fault of the country where the polling stations are located.

title: 习近平电贺普京“当选连任”，传北京考虑参加瑞士举行的乌克兰和会
content:
俄罗斯总统弗拉迪米尔·普京（Vladimir Putin）在一场没有真正对手的总统大选中毫无悬念地取得大胜之后，中国国家主席习近平星期一（3月18日）致电普京，祝贺他当选连任，承诺与俄方保持密切沟通，推动中俄关系持续深入发展。

与此同时，中国驻瑞士大使王世廷表示，北京密切关注瑞士即将主办的乌克兰和会，而且中国正在考虑参与这一会议的可能性。

俄罗斯在普京发动的侵略乌克兰的战争进入第三个年头之际举行新的总统大选，但是真正受到民意支持的两位反战候选人却被克里姆林宫禁止参选，而普京最害怕的反对派领导人奥列克西·纳瓦尔尼（Alexei Navalny）上个月在西伯利亚北极圈内一所监狱中不明不白地死亡，因此普京在星期天结束的选举中取得“压倒性”的胜利并不令人意外。
“你再次当选，充分体现了俄罗斯人民对你的支持，”习近平在致普京的贺电中表示。“相信在你的领导下，俄罗斯一定能够取得国家发展建设的更大成就。”

普京2022年2月悍然挥军入侵乌克兰后，俄罗斯遭到美国和西方盟国的强烈谴责和一轮又一轮严厉制裁。但是北京不仅没有指责莫斯科的侵略行动，反而趁机加强与俄罗斯的政治、外交和经贸关系，甚至大肆购买俄罗斯因为西方制裁卖不掉而被迫打折出售的能源产品，包括石油和天然气。

普京在发动乌克兰战争前曾专门访问北京，并与习近平签署了一系列号称“上不封顶”的合作文件。中俄两国在面对美国和西方抵制时背靠背抱团取暖的意图十分明显。

“中方高度重视中俄关系发展，愿同俄方保持密切沟通，推动中俄新时代全面战略协作伙伴关系持续健康稳定深入发展，造福两国和两国人民，”习近平的贺电说。

据中国官媒的报道，习近平与普京今年将有多次会晤的机会。

“中俄互为最大邻国和新时代全面战略协作伙伴。
translation:
After Russian President Vladimir Putin won an unquestionable victory in a presidential election with no real opponent, Chinese President Xi Jinping called Putin on Monday (March 18) to congratulate him on his re-election. , committed to maintaining close communication with Russia and promoting the continued and in-depth development of Sino-Russian relations.

Meanwhile, China's ambassador to Switzerland Wang Shiting said Beijing was paying close attention to the Ukraine peace conference that Switzerland was about to host and that China was considering the possibility of participating in the conference.

Russia is holding a new presidential election as Putin's war of aggression against Ukraine enters its third year, but two anti-war candidates with real popular support are banned from running by the Kremlin, while the opposition leader Putin fears most Putin's "overwhelming" victory in the election that ended on Sunday came as no surprise after Alexei Navalny died under mysterious circumstances in a prison above the Siberian Arctic Circle last month. .
"Your re-election fully reflects the Russian people's support for you," Xi Jinping said in a congratulatory message to Putin. "I believe that under your leadership, Russia will be able to achieve greater achievements in national development and construction."

After Putin brazenly invaded Ukraine in February 2022, Russia was strongly condemned by the United States and Western allies and met with rounds of severe sanctions. However, instead of accusing Moscow of its aggressive actions, Beijing took the opportunity to strengthen political, diplomatic, and economic and trade relations with Russia, and even aggressively purchased energy products, including oil and natural gas, that Russia was forced to sell at a discount due to Western sanctions.

Before launching the war in Ukraine, Putin made a special visit to Beijing and signed a series of cooperation documents with Xi Jinping known as "unlimited". China and Russia have obvious intentions of holding back-to-back to warm up in the face of resistance from the United States and the West.

"China attaches great importance to the development of Sino-Russian relations and is willing to maintain close communication with Russia to promote the sustained, healthy, stable and in-depth development of the China-Russia comprehensive strategic partnership of coordination for a new era to the benefit of the two countries and their peoples," Xi Jinping's congratulatory message said.

According to reports from Chinese state media, Xi Jinping and Putin will have multiple meetings this year.

“China and Russia are each other’s largest neighbors and comprehensive strategic partners of coordination in the new era.

title: Russia election: Putin declared winner of race that was never in doubt | AP News
content:
Sullivan, the U.S. national security adviser, disputed those claims. He told reporters during a White House briefing Monday that U.S. officials had spoken to Russia for “months and years” about releasing American detainees but “have not heard a Russian official raise Navalny as part of a prisoner swap in any of these conversations.”
Supporters of Navalny streamed to his grave in Moscow, some bringing ballots with his name written on them.
The Russian leader brushed off the effectiveness of the apparent protest and rejected Western criticism of the vote. Instead, he tried to turn the tables on the West, charging that the four criminal cases against former President Donald Trump were a use of the judiciary for political aims.
“The whole world is laughing at it,” he said.
Some people told the AP that they were happy to vote for Putin — unsurprising in a country where state TV airs a drumbeat of praise for the Russian leader and voicing any other opinion is risky.
Dmitry Sergienko, who cast his ballot in Moscow, said, “I am happy with everything and want everything to continue as it is now.”
Voting took place over three days at polling stations across the vast country, in illegally annexed regions of Ukraine and online.
Several people were arrested, including in Moscow and St. Petersburg, after they tried to start fires or set off explosives at polling stations while a few others were detained for throwing green antiseptic or ink into ballot boxes. Many more were rounded up by police for attempting to protest. 
The OVD-Info group that monitors political arrests said that about 90 people were arrested in 22 cities across Russia on Sunday.
Stanislav Andreychuk, co-chair of the Golos independent election watchdog, said Russians were searched when entering polling stations, there were attempts to check filled-out ballots before they were cast, and one report said police demanded a ballot box be opened to remove a ballot.
Huge lines formed around noon outside diplomatic missions in London, Berlin, Paris and other cities with large Russian communities, many of whom left home after Putin’s invasion of Ukraine. 
This story has been updated to correct that Putin referred to Navalny by name for the first time in years in his remarks after polls closed.

“The whole world is laughing at it,” he said.

title: 俄罗斯部分地区开始提前投票选举总统
content:
据塔斯社25日消息，俄罗斯总统选举提前投票已经启动，一些交通不便和偏远地区的选民从当天开始投票选举总统。
消息说，阿尔泰边疆区、阿尔汉格尔斯克州、堪察加边疆区、克拉斯诺亚尔斯克边疆区等30多个地区的部分选民可提前投票选举总统。居住在上述地方偏远地区的选民从2月25日开始可提前投票，而居住在国外的俄罗斯选民从3月1日开始也可以提前投票，但两部分选民的投票活动都须在3月14日结束，具体投票日期各地区有差异。
可参与提前投票的选民群体包括猎人、渔民、伐木工、矿工、灯塔和自然保护区工作人员、偏远地区边防站军人、总统选举正式投票期间在船舶上航行的选民、居住在国外的选民等。距投票站较远的选民群体也可提前投票。
俄罗斯总统选举正式投票将于3月15日至17日进行，包括现任总统普京在内的4名候选人参选。
translation:
According to the TASS news agency on the 25th, early voting for the Russian presidential election has been launched. Voters in some areas with inaccessible and remote areas can vote for the president starting from the same day.
According to the news, some voters in more than 30 regions including Altai Krai, Arkhangelsk Oblast, Kamchatka Krai and Krasnoyarsk Territory can vote for the president in advance. Voters living in remote areas of the above places can vote in advance starting from February 25, while Russian voters living abroad can also vote in advance starting from March 1, but voting activities for both groups of voters must be on March 14 Ending, the specific voting dates vary by region.
Groups of voters who can participate in early voting include hunters, fishermen, loggers, miners, lighthouse and nature reserve workers, soldiers at border stations in remote areas, voters sailing on ships during the official voting period for the presidential election, and voters living abroad. Voter groups further from polling stations can also vote early.
The official voting for the Russian presidential election will be held from March 15th to 17th. Four candidates, including current President Vladimir Putin, are running.
input:
According to the TASS news agency on the 25th, early voting for the Russian presidential election has been launched. Voters in some areas with inaccessible and remote areas can vote for the president starting from the same day.
According to the news, some voters in more than 30 regions including Altai Krai, Arkhangelsk Oblast, Kamchatka Krai and Krasnoyarsk Territory can vote for the president in advance. Voters living in remote areas of the above places can vote in advance starting from February 25, while Russian voters living abroad can also vote in advance starting from March 1, but voting activities for both groups of voters must be on March 14 Ending, the specific voting dates vary by region.
Groups of voters who can participate in early voting include hunters, fishermen, loggers, miners, lighthouse and nature reserve workers, soldiers at border stations in remote areas, voters sailing on ships during the official voting period for the presidential election, and voters living abroad. Voter groups further from polling stations can also vote early.
The official voting for the Russian presidential election will be held from March 15th to 17th. Four candidates, including current President Vladimir Putin, are running.

title: 俄罗斯大选：普京宣布获压倒性胜利， 数千民众抗议“操纵选举” - BBC News 中文
content:
俄罗斯官方公布，根据初步计票结果，现任总统普京获得超过87%的得票率，笃定获胜，将连任至2030年。在竞选总部宣布胜选时，普京向选民和在乌作战的俄罗斯士兵表示感谢。
然而，美国等国家称这次选举“不合法”。投票最后一日（3月17 日）中午，数千俄罗斯民众涌向各地投票站，参与反对派号召的“午”逆普京活动，数十名抗议者被捕。
如果普京的87%得票率到确认，他将成为自苏联解体以来得票率最高的俄罗斯候选人。同时，他也将超越斯大林，成为200多年来在位时间最长的俄罗斯领导人。
translation:
Russian officials announced that according to preliminary vote counting results, current President Vladimir Putin received more than 87% of the vote and is certain to win and will be re-elected until 2030. When announcing his victory at the campaign headquarters, Putin expressed his gratitude to voters and Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine.
However, the United States and other countries called the election "illegitimate." At noon on the last day of voting (March 17), thousands of Russians flocked to polling stations across the country to participate in the "noon" anti-Putin activities called by the opposition. Dozens of protesters were arrested.
If Putin's 87% of the vote is confirmed, he will become the Russian candidate with the highest vote share since the collapse of the Soviet Union. At the same time, he will also surpass Stalin and become the Russian leader with the longest reign in more than 200 years.
input:
Russian officials announced that according to preliminary vote counting results, current President Vladimir Putin received more than 87% of the vote and is certain to win and will be re-elected until 2030. When announcing his victory at the campaign headquarters, Putin expressed his gratitude to voters and Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine.
However, the United States and other countries called the election "illegitimate." At noon on the last day of voting (March 17), thousands of Russians flocked to polling stations across the country to participate in the "noon" anti-Putin activities called by the opposition. Dozens of protesters were arrested.
If Putin's 87% of the vote is confirmed, he will become the Russian candidate with the highest vote share since the collapse of the Soviet Union. At the same time, he will also surpass Stalin and become the Russian leader with the longest reign in more than 200 years.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·选民｜年轻的俄罗斯人怎么想？
content:
有人说俄罗斯因为战争变得很危险，如果你是个男人，也许很危险吧，但我不这么认为，因为现在这里真的没有发生任何事情。
但现在一些国际品牌涨价了很多。2年前，一双耐克鞋要5000-8000卢布（约人民币393-628元），但现在同样的耐克鞋至少要1.5万卢布（约人民币1177元），还没法随意买到，因为没有官方的耐克店。有很多人在土耳其或阿联酋迪拜买耐克和其他品牌带回俄罗斯卖，价格上涨50%或更多。不过也有些人在中国有朋友，他们可以拜托朋友从线上潮流交易平台“poizon”买，然后从中国邮寄过来。邮费大概在1公斤300-500卢布，和那些从土耳其带回来的鞋子相比超级便宜。我今年夏天也打算从“poizon”买一些鞋子。
不过我们也有很多俄罗斯的本土好品牌。
至于战争对我的影响，就我个人而言，只是在心理上。一开始压力很大。我在乌克兰有很多亲戚，这真的让我很悲伤。
说到大选，我们现在只有一个反对战争的候选人，就是纳杰日丁（注：因提交竞选材料存在问题、未能收集足够签名等原因，纳杰日丁最终未能获得参选资格）。我不关心任何政治，我不想选择一方，我甚至不想去想它。一个月前，我想离开俄罗斯去亚美尼亚或格鲁吉亚，我想要和平，我希望自己能有权利不害怕这一切。但很困难。需要签证，需要一个在他国留下的理由，需要学习一门语言，而且还可能被驱逐出境或者被歧视。但人们现在为了移民，越来越多地去学习英语，英语教学网站正在增多。
“克里米亚是谁的？”
translation:
Some people say that Russia has become dangerous because of the war, maybe dangerous if you are a man, but I don't think so because nothing is really happening here right now.
But now some international brands have increased their prices a lot. Two years ago, a pair of Nike shoes cost 5,000-8,000 rubles (approximately RMB 393-628 yuan), but now the same Nike shoes cost at least 15,000 rubles (approximately RMB 1,177 yuan). You can’t buy them casually because there is no official Nike store. There are many people who buy Nike and other brands in Turkey or Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and bring them back to Russia to sell them, with prices rising by 50% or more. However, some people have friends in China. They can ask their friends to buy them from the online fashion trading platform "poizon" and then mail them from China. The postage is about 300-500 rubles per kilogram, which is super cheap compared to the shoes brought back from Turkey. I am also planning to buy some shoes from "poizon" this summer.
But we also have many good local Russian brands.
As for the impact of the war on me, personally, it was only psychological. It was very stressful at first. I have a lot of relatives in Ukraine and this really makes me sad.
Speaking of the general election, we now have only one candidate who opposes the war, and that is Nadezdin (Note: Due to problems in submitting campaign materials, failure to collect enough signatures, etc., Nadezdin was ultimately unable to qualify for the election). I don't care about any politics, I don't want to choose a side, I don't even want to think about it. A month ago, I wanted to leave Russia and go to Armenia or Georgia. I wanted peace and I wanted the right not to be afraid of all this. But it's difficult. You need a visa, you need a reason to stay in the other country, you need to learn a language, and you may be deported or discriminated against. But now more and more people are learning English in order to immigrate, and English teaching websites are increasing.
"Whose Crimea is it?"

Two years ago, a pair of Nike shoes cost 5,000-8,000 rubles (approximately RMB 393-628 yuan), but now the same Nike shoes cost at least 15,000 rubles (approximately RMB 1,177 yuan). You can’t buy them casually because there is no official Nike store. There are many people who buy Nike and other brands in Turkey or Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and bring them back to Russia to sell them, with prices rising by 50% or more. However, some people have friends in China. They can ask their friends to buy them from the online fashion trading platform "poizon" and then mail them from China. The postage is about 300-500 rubles per kilogram, which is super cheap compared to the shoes brought back from Turkey. I am also planning to buy some shoes from "poizon" this summer.
But we also have many good local Russian brands.
As for the impact of the war on me, personally, it was only psychological. It was very stressful at first. I have a lot of relatives in Ukraine and this really makes me sad.
Speaking of the general election, we now have only one candidate who opposes the war, and that is Nadezdin (Note: Due to problems in submitting campaign materials, failure to collect enough signatures, etc., Nadezdin was ultimately unable to qualify for the election). I don't care about any politics, I don't want to choose a side, I don't even want to think about it. A month ago, I wanted to leave Russia and go to Armenia or Georgia. You need a visa, you need a reason to stay in the other country, you need to learn a language, and you may be deported or discriminated against. But now more and more people are learning English in order to immigrate, and English teaching websites are increasing.

title: Российские «выборы»: взгляд изнутри и со стороны
content:
Комментарии экспертов

Тем временем, объявленные властями цифры, похоже, восприняты в Кремле с удовлетворением, несмотря на зарубежную критику всего процесса, сказал в комментарии для Русской службы «Голоса Америки» эксперт движения «Голос» Давид Канкия. По его словам, это тешит самолюбие властей и якобы доказывает, что все принятые в последние годы решения поддерживаются большинством общества.

«На самом деле выборы проводятся в первую очередь не потому что, как прописано в Конституции, надо выявлять волю народа и на основе этого формировать властные структуры, а потому, что в стране установлена перевернутая пирамида, – уточнил он. – Для власти это лишний повод проверить, насколько лояльны к ней, “родимой”, население и бюрократический аппарат, и насколько последний готов выполнить любые поставленные задачи. По сути дела население и бюрократия проходят тест перед инкубментом (действующим держателем должности – В.В.), а не наоборот».

Если цель Кремля состояла в том, чтобы “сделать приятное” Владимиру Путину, то она реализована, также констатировал Давид Канкия: «Если же цель была убедить кого-то в легитимности выборов, мне кажется, то до этого очень далеко. Все, что мы видели по ходу избирательной кампании в дни голосования, а также международная реакция на это и тот интерес, например, который был к материалам и аналитике «Голоса», говорит о том, что альтернативная точка зрения в России по-прежнему востребована. И те, кто сомневался в честности осуществляемой в РФ электоральной процедуры, лишь укрепились в своем мнении».

Кроме того, стало понятно, что те, кто не хочет получить альтернативную информацию, он ее и не будет получать, продолжил эксперт: «Сейчас по факту две России, которые существуют в двух разных информационных пространствах с разными повестками, и им присуще совершенно разное видение выборов. Люди, которых заставляли приходить на избирательные участки и подневольно голосовать, а также члены комиссии, переписывавшие протоколы в нарушение закона, прекрасно понимают настоящую цену таким выборам. Как и администрация президента, которая ко всему этому приложила руку».

Но нынешнему хозяину Кремля, наверное, приятно – по крайней мере, он, очевидно, считает, что всё в его силах, всех можно заставить плясать под его дудку и даже сделать вид, что они верят в предъявленные проценты, резюмировал Давид Канкия.

Российские власти в результате президентской компании достигли всего, чего хотели, считает политолог Федор Крашенинников. По его мнению, их абсолютно не смущает то, какими методами были получены искомые результаты.

«Теперь они любой нюанс будут трактовать в свою пользу, – добавил он в комментарии «Голосу Америки». – Например, в Украине выборов нет, а в России они прошли. Поэтому в Кремле будут говорить, что Путин легитимен, а Зеленский - нет. Помимо того, сомнения в результатах выборов есть вовне, а не внутри России. Внутри любая «крамола» беспощадно подавляется. Но власть и пропаганда станут без устали твердить, что Путин законно выбран, причем с подавляющим преимуществом».

Чрезмерно высокий процент за Путина объясняется тем, что в Кремле убеждены: во время войны весь народ должен объединиться вокруг лидера, считает Федор Крашенинников: «Хотя понятно, что рекордный результат достигнут исключительно за счет небывалых прежде фальсификаций. Мало того, что электронное голосование – неконтролируемая бездна, так еще выявлено, что десятки миллионов людей, многих из которых скорее всего вообще не существуют или же те, кто просто не ходил на выборы, тем не менее “волеизъявились” как надо. То же самое касается голосования на оккупированных украинских территориях. Там всех повально записывали в избиратели. Таким образом, вообще невозможно анализировать эти выборы с учетом огромного количества приписок и других махинаций».

Конечно, и за Путина голосовало много людей, но, разумеется, не в таких абсурдных количествах, заключил политолог.

Инаугурация Владимира Путина намечена на 7 мая нынешнего года. Его предполагаемый период правления – шесть лет.
translation:
Expert comments

Meanwhile, the figures announced by the authorities seem to have been received with satisfaction in the Kremlin, despite foreign criticism of the entire process, David Kankia, an expert with the Voice movement, said in a commentary for the Russian service of the Voice of America. According to him, this pleases the pride of the authorities and supposedly proves that all decisions made in recent years are supported by the majority of society.

“In fact, elections are held primarily not because, as stated in the Constitution, it is necessary to identify the will of the people and on the basis of this to form power structures, but because an inverted pyramid has been established in the country,” he clarified. – For the authorities, this is another reason to check how loyal the population and the bureaucratic apparatus are to it, “darling”, and how ready the latter is to fulfill any assigned tasks. In fact, the population and the bureaucracy are tested before the incubator (the current holder of the position - V.V.), and not vice versa.”

If the Kremlin’s goal was to “please” Vladimir Putin, then it has been realized, David Kankia also stated: “If the goal was to convince someone of the legitimacy of the elections, it seems to me that this is very far away. Everything that we saw during the election campaign on voting days, as well as the international reaction to this and the interest, for example, in the materials and analytics of Golos, suggests that an alternative point of view is still in demand in Russia. And those who doubted the integrity of the electoral procedure carried out in the Russian Federation only strengthened their opinion.”

In addition, it became clear that those who do not want to receive alternative information will not receive it, the expert continued: “Now, in fact, there are two Russias, which exist in two different information spaces with different agendas, and they have completely different visions elections. People who were forced to come to polling stations and vote involuntarily, as well as members of the commission who rewrote protocols in violation of the law, understand perfectly well the real cost of such elections. Just like the presidential administration, which had a hand in all this.”

But the current owner of the Kremlin is probably pleased - at least he obviously believes that everything is in his power, everyone can be forced to dance to his tune and even pretend that they believe in the interest rates presented, David Kankia summarized.

As a result of the presidential campaign, the Russian authorities achieved everything they wanted, says political scientist Fyodor Krasheninnikov. In his opinion, they are not at all confused by the methods by which the desired results were obtained.

“Now they will interpret any nuance in their favor,” he added in a comment to Voice of America. – For example, there are no elections in Ukraine, but they took place in Russia. Therefore, the Kremlin will say that Putin is legitimate, but Zelensky is not. In addition, there are doubts about the election results outside, not inside Russia. Inside, any “sedition” is mercilessly suppressed. But the authorities and propaganda will tirelessly repeat that Putin was legitimately elected, and with an overwhelming advantage.”

The excessively high percentage for Putin is explained by the fact that the Kremlin is convinced that during a war, the entire people should unite around the leader, believes Fyodor Krasheninnikov: “Although it is clear that the record result was achieved solely due to unprecedented falsifications. Not only is electronic voting an uncontrollable abyss, but it has also been revealed that tens of millions of people, many of whom most likely do not exist at all, or those who simply did not go to the polls, nevertheless “expressed their will” as they should. The same applies to voting in the occupied Ukrainian territories. Everyone there was en masse enrolling as voters. Thus, it is generally impossible to analyze these elections taking into account the huge number of attributions and other frauds.”

Of course, many people voted for Putin, but, of course, not in such absurd numbers, the political scientist concluded.

Vladimir Putin's inauguration is scheduled for May 7 this year. His estimated reign is six years.

title: Putin's Reelection Confirms Russia Is 'Authoritarian Society,' Says NATO Chief
content:
Obviously, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic initially said yes to the agreement without intending to sign it and then regretted saying yes, as Mrs. Brnabic's letter explained," Kurti said.
"I believe that whoever mentions an association of Serbian-majority municipalities outside the basic agreement or before it serving Serbia's quest to turn Kosovo into Bosnia," he said, adding that such an association has to be established withing the framework of the Kosovar Constitution.
"In Brussels I said one cannot serve coffee without a cup. If you ask for coffee without a cup, I will show you an empty cup. The cup is the Republic of Kosovo. What is the legal framework of the association? Is it the constitution of the Republic of Kosova or that of Serbia? If I'm there, it's the constitution of the Republic of Kosovo. No coffee without a cup.
"This is crucial to understand. Belgrade wants to put the cart before the horses. It's not possible. There will be no movement as we have seen since February and March last year," he said, adding that he was ready to go to Brussels again together with Vucic.
Referring to the frustration voiced by the United States and the European Union because of the lack of progress toward the Serbian dinar and the municipalities association, Kurti said that while they are indispensable partners, sometimes differences may arise.
"I consider United States an indispensable ally, friend, and partner. But this does not mean that we have an identical stance toward official Belgrade. As the prime minister of Kosovo, I cannot regard Belgrade through the eyes of the State Department...they do not see Belgrade as I see them. We do not have an identical stance. We have a different experience and history," Kurti said.

title: Russia election: Putin basks in electoral victory even as Russians quietly protest | AP News
content:
Independent media have been crippled. His fiercest political foe, Alexei Navalny, died in an Arctic prison last month, and other critics are either in jail or in exile.
Beyond the fact that voters had virtually no choice, independent monitoring of the election was extremely limited. According to Russia’s Central Election Commission, Putin had some 87% of the vote with about 90% of precincts counted. 
In that tightly controlled environment, Navalny’s associates urged those unhappy with Putin or the war in Ukraine to go to the polls at noon on Sunday — and lines outside a number of polling stations both inside Russia and at its embassies around the world appeared to swell at that time.
Among those heeding call was Yulia Navalnaya, Navalny’s widow, who joined a long line in Berlin as some in the crowd applauded and chanted her name.
She spent more than five hours in the line and told reporters after casting her vote that she wrote her late husband’s name on the ballot. 
Asked whether she had a message for Putin, Navalnaya replied: “Please stop asking for messages from me or from somebody for Mr. Putin. There could be no negotiations and nothing with Mr. Putin, because he’s a killer, he’s a gangster.”
But Putin brushed off the effectiveness of the apparent protest.
“There were calls to come vote at noon. And this was supposed to be a manifestation of opposition. Well, if there were calls to come vote, then ... I praise this,” he said at a news conference after polls closed.

Beyond the fact that voters had virtually no choice, independent monitoring of the election was extremely limited. According to Russia’s Central Election Commission, Putin had some 87% of the vote with about 90% of precincts counted. 
In that tightly controlled environment, Navalny’s associates urged those unhappy with Putin or the war in Ukraine to go to the polls at noon on Sunday — and lines outside a number of polling stations both inside Russia and at its embassies around the world appeared to swell at that time.
Among those heeding call was Yulia Navalnaya, Navalny’s widow, who joined a long line in Berlin as some in the crowd applauded and chanted her name.
She spent more than five hours in the line and told reporters after casting her vote that she wrote her late husband’s name on the ballot. 
Asked whether she had a message for Putin, Navalnaya replied: “Please stop asking for messages from me or from somebody for Mr. Putin. There could be no negotiations and nothing with Mr. Putin, because he’s a killer, he’s a gangster.”
But Putin brushed off the effectiveness of the apparent protest.
“There were calls to come vote at noon. And this was supposed to be a manifestation of opposition. Well, if there were calls to come vote, then ... I praise this,” he said at a news conference after polls closed.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·议题｜参军、跳槽、养娃……“我们在同一条船上”
content:
战争带来的心理上的痛苦与挣扎绵延不绝，但普通人的生活终究要继续。在顿河畔罗斯托夫，生活在大多数时候仍然平静。面对着不断上涨的物价 ，人们在为了维持生活而加倍努力工作的同时，也期盼着和平尽快到来，生活能够恢复如前。军事动员曾是人们最大的恐惧。但随着冲突持续、战况日渐明晰，这种担忧也不再像之前那样强烈。
对于安德烈个人而言，战火并没有给他的生活带来非常深刻的冲击。他只隐隐约约记得，去年曾经有无人机在他所生活的城市被击落。如果说这两年中曾有什么事情短暂地打破过他生活的平静，那大概就是普里戈任2023年6月发起的“叛乱”。
当时，自顿河畔罗斯托夫起事的普里戈任和瓦格纳士兵曾在这里受到许多人的支持。2个月后，普里戈任与多名瓦格纳高官坠机身亡。
面对无力改变的局面，安德烈将目光从政治中移开，转而关注自己的生活。他用这样一句话总结自己对战争的态度：“老实说，我不想找出谁对谁错，我只想结束这一切。”
目前，他正在一家家具公司工作，日常工作之外还会花时间学外语来为自己探索更多可能，时不时通过摄影赚一些外快，偶尔也会拍一些视频上传到社交平台上。对于未来，安德烈仍有自己的期盼。
“如果说俄罗斯市场从前有很多外国产品，那么现在则少了，出现了很多新的机遇。这会让你有动力做出自己的品牌和事业。比如俄罗斯版的YouTube，俄罗斯版的Spotify。我现在就在制作视频，不过只是一个爱好，而且粉丝不多。今年春天，我考虑换一份工作，内容应该是社交媒体营销方向。”
军工企业工程师：准备跳槽中
在战火之下看到新的机遇的人，并不只有年轻的安德烈。由于战争极大推动了俄罗斯军工企业的发展，今年已经56岁的尤里刚刚获得了一份新的工作邀约。
尤里目前是俄乌边境地带一家俄罗斯公司的首席工程师，他的工作内容属于钢铁制造的最初阶段，也即矿石开采和选矿流程。战争前，尤里所在的公司曾有一半的钢材销往海外。然而，俄乌冲突爆发后，西方国家开始禁止自俄罗斯购买钢材。现在，这些钢材多被俄罗斯政府买走，用以制造军事装备、炮弹等战争所需物资。
俄乌冲突后，俄罗斯大幅提高国防开支，并加大对军工企业的扶持力度。
translation:
The psychological pain and struggle caused by the war are endless, but the lives of ordinary people will continue after all. In Rostov-on-Don, life remains peaceful most of the time. Faced with rising prices, while people are working harder to maintain their lives, they are also looking forward to peace coming as soon as possible and life to return to what it was before. Military mobilization was once people's greatest fear. But as the conflict continues and the situation becomes clearer, this concern is no longer as strong as before.
For Andre personally, the war did not have a very profound impact on his life. He only vaguely remembered that a drone was shot down in the city where he lived last year. If there was anything that briefly broke the tranquility of his life in the past two years, it was probably the "rebellion" launched by Prigozhin in June 2023.
At that time, the Prigozhin and Wagner soldiers who rose up from Rostov-on-Don were supported by many people here. Two months later, Prigozhin and many senior Wagner officials died in a plane crash.
Faced with a situation that he was unable to change, Andre turned his attention away from politics and focused on his own life. He summed up his attitude towards the war with this sentence: "Honestly, I don't want to find out who is right and who is wrong, I just want it to end."
Currently, he is working in a furniture company. In addition to his daily work, he also spends time learning foreign languages ​​to explore more possibilities for himself. From time to time, he earns some extra money through photography, and occasionally shoots videos and uploads them to social platforms. Andre still has his own expectations for the future.
"If there used to be many foreign products in the Russian market, now there are fewer, and many new opportunities have emerged. This will give you the motivation to build your own brand and business. For example, the Russian version of YouTube, the Russian version of Spotify. I I’m making videos now, but it’s just a hobby, and I don’t have many fans. This spring, I’m considering changing my job, and the content should be in the direction of social media marketing.”
Military industrial enterprise engineer: preparing to change jobs
Young Andre was not the only person who saw new opportunities under the flames of war. Since the war has greatly promoted the development of Russian military industrial enterprises, Yuri, who is 56 years old this year, has just received a new job offer.
Yuri is currently the chief engineer of a Russian company on the Russian-Ukrainian border. His work belongs to the initial stage of steel manufacturing, that is, the ore mining and beneficiation process. Before the war, Yuri's company sold half of its steel overseas. However, after the conflict between Russia and Ukraine broke out, Western countries began to ban the purchase of steel from Russia. Now, most of these steels are bought by the Russian government and used to make military equipment, artillery shells and other war supplies.
After the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Russia significantly increased its defense spending and increased its support for military-industrial enterprises.

Faced with a situation that he was unable to change, Andre turned his attention away from politics and focused on his own life. He summed up his attitude towards the war with this sentence: "Honestly, I don't want to find out who is right and who is wrong, I just want it to end."

From time to time, he earns some extra money through photography, and occasionally shoots videos and uploads them to social platforms. Andre still has his own expectations for the future.
"If there used to be many foreign products in the Russian market, now there are fewer, and many new opportunities have emerged. This will give you the motivation to build your own brand and business. For example, the Russian version of YouTube, the Russian version of Spotify. I I’m making videos now, but it’s just a hobby, and I don’t have many fans. This spring, I’m considering changing my job, and the content should be in the direction of social media marketing.”
Military industrial enterprise engineer: preparing to change jobs
Young Andre was not the only person who saw new opportunities under the flames of war. Since the war has greatly promoted the development of Russian military industrial enterprises, Yuri, who is 56 years old this year, has just received a new job offer.

His work belongs to the initial stage of steel manufacturing, that is, the ore mining and beneficiation process. Before the war, Yuri's company sold half of its steel overseas. However, after the conflict between Russia and Ukraine broke out, Western countries began to ban the purchase of steel from Russia.
